1: %% @doc Property-based tests for router_policy_store
    2: %% Uses PropEr for randomized sequence of operations to detect race conditions
    3: -module(router_policy_store_prop_SUITE).
    4: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    5: 
    6: %% Check if PropEr is available
    7: -ifdef(TEST).
    8: -define(HAVE_PROPER, code:which(proper) =/= non_existing).
    9: -else.
   10: -define(HAVE_PROPER, false).
   11: -endif.
   12: 
   13: -ifdef(HAVE_PROPER).
   14: -include_lib("proper/include/proper.hrl").
   15: -endif.
   16: 
   17: -compile(export_all).
   18: 
   19: -export([all/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   20: 
   21: -include("beamline_router.hrl").
   22: 
   23: all() ->
   24:     [
   25:         prop_concurrent_operations,
   26:         prop_upsert_delete_consistency,
   27:         prop_list_policies_ordering,
   28:         prop_index_consistency
   29:     ].
   30: 
   31: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   32:     %% Start application with ephemeral port
   33:     _ = application:load(beamline_router),
   34:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_port, 0),
   35:     %% Disable heir/transfer logic for faster test execution
   36:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, disable_heir, true),
   37:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_enabled, false),
   38:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, nats_mode, mock),
   39:     case application:ensure_all_started(beamline_router) of
   40:         {ok, _} ->
   41:             Config;
   42:         Error ->
   43:             ct:fail("Failed to start beamline_router: ~p", [Error])
   44:     end.
   45: 
   46: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   47:     application:stop(beamline_router),
   48:     ok.
   49: 
   50: %% Property: Concurrent operations maintain consistency
   51: prop_concurrent_operations(_Config) ->
   52:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
   53:         false ->
   54:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
   55:         true ->
   56:             Prop = ?FORALL(
   57:                 Operations,
   58:                 list(operation()),
   59:                 begin
   60:                     TenantId = <<"prop_tenant">>,
   61:                     %% Execute operations sequentially (gen_server serializes)
   62:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Operations],
   63:                     
   64:                     %% Verify final state is consistent
   65:                     {ok, FinalPolicies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
   66:                     
   67:                     %% Check: all policies in list should be valid
   68:                     AllValid = lists:all(fun(P) ->
   69:                         is_record(P, policy) andalso
   70:                         P#policy.tenant_id =:= TenantId
   71:                     end, FinalPolicies),
   72:                     
   73:                     %% Check: no duplicate policy_ids
   74:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- FinalPolicies],
   75:                     NoDuplicates = length(PolicyIds) =:= length(lists:usort(PolicyIds)),
   76:                     
   77:                     AllValid andalso NoDuplicates
   78:                 end
   79:             ),
   80:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}]) of
   81:                 true -> ok;
   82:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
   83:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
   84:             end
   85:     end.
   86: 
   87: %% Property: Upsert and delete maintain consistency
   88: prop_upsert_delete_consistency(_Config) ->
   89:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
   90:         false ->
   91:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
   92:         true ->
   93:             Prop = ?FORALL(
   94:                 {Upserts, Deletes},
   95:                 {list(upsert_operation()), list(delete_operation())},
   96:                 begin
   97:                     TenantId = <<"prop_consistency_tenant">>,
   98:                     
   99:                     %% Execute all upserts
  100:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Upserts],
  101:                     
  102:                     %% Execute all deletes
  103:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Deletes],
  104:                     
  105:                     %% Verify: deleted policies should not be in list
  106:                     {ok, Policies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  107:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- Policies],
  108:                     
  109:                     %% Get deleted policy IDs
  110:                     DeletedIds = [PolicyId || {delete, PolicyId} <- Deletes],
  111:                     
  112:                     %% Check: no deleted policy should be in final list
  113:                     lists:all(fun(DeletedId) ->
  114:                         not lists:member(DeletedId, PolicyIds)
  115:                     end, DeletedIds)
  116:                 end
  117:             ),
  118:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}]) of
  119:                 true -> ok;
  120:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  121:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
  122:             end
  123:     end.
  124: 
  125: %% Property: list_policies always returns sorted results
  126: prop_list_policies_ordering(_Config) ->
  127:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
  128:         false ->
  129:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
  130:         true ->
  131:             Prop = ?FORALL(
  132:                 Policies,
  133:                 list(policy()),
  134:                 begin
  135:                     TenantId = <<"prop_ordering_tenant">>,
  136:                     
  137:                     %% Clear existing policies
  138:                     {ok, Existing} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  139:                     [router_policy_store:delete_policy(TenantId, P#policy.policy_id) || P <- Existing],
  140:                     
  141:                     %% Insert all policies
  142:                     [router_policy_store:upsert_policy(TenantId, P) || P <- Policies],
  143:                     
  144:                     %% Get list
  145:                     {ok, Listed} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  146:                     
  147:                     %% Check: results are sorted by policy_id (lexicographic binary order)
  148:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- Listed],
  149:                     Sorted = lists:sort(fun(Id1, Id2) ->
  150:                         binary:compare(Id1, Id2) =:= less
  151:                     end, PolicyIds),
  152:                     
  153:                     PolicyIds =:= Sorted
  154:                 end
  155:             ),
  156:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}]) of
  157:                 true -> ok;
  158:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  159:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
  160:             end
  161:     end.
  162: 
  163: %% Property: Secondary index maintains consistency with main table
  164: prop_index_consistency(_Config) ->
  165:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
  166:         false ->
  167:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
  168:         true ->
  169:             Prop = ?FORALL(
  170:                 Operations,
  171:                 list(operation()),
  172:                 begin
  173:                     TenantId = <<"prop_index_tenant">>,
  174:                     
  175:                     %% Execute operations
  176:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Operations],
  177:                     
  178:                     %% Get policies via list_policies (uses index)
  179:                     {ok, IndexedPolicies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  180:                     IndexedIds = lists:sort([P#policy.policy_id || P <- IndexedPolicies]),
  181:                     
  182:                     %% Get policies via direct lookup (bypasses index)
  183:                     AllKeys = ets:match(policy_store, {{TenantId, '$1'}, '_'}),
  184:                     DirectIds = lists:sort([Id || [Id] <- AllKeys]),
  185:                     
  186:                     %% Check: index and direct lookup should match
  187:                     IndexConsistent = IndexedIds =:= DirectIds,
  188:                     
  189:                     %% Check: for each {TenantId, PolicyId} in main table, there's exactly one entry in index
  190:                     IndexTable = policy_store_index,
  191:                     AllIndexEntries = ets:match_object(IndexTable, {TenantId, '_'}),
  192:                     IndexPolicyIds = lists:sort([PolicyId || {_TenantId, PolicyId} <- AllIndexEntries]),
  193:                     
  194:                     %% Check: all policies in main table have corresponding index entries
  195:                     AllMainPolicies = ets:match_object(policy_store, {{TenantId, '_'}, '_'}),
  196:                     MainPolicyIds = lists:sort([PolicyId || {{_TenantId, PolicyId}, _Policy} <- AllMainPolicies]),
  197:                     
  198:                     IndexComplete = MainPolicyIds =:= IndexPolicyIds,
  199:                     
  200:                     %% Check: bag index invariants
  201:                     %% 1. Each {TenantId, PolicyId} pair appears exactly once in index
  202:                     %% Bag allows multiple entries per key, but each {tenant_id, policy_id} pair should be unique
  203:                     IndexPairs = [{T, P} || {T, P} <- AllIndexEntries],
  204:                     UniquePairs = lists:usort(IndexPairs),
  205:                     NoDuplicates = length(IndexPairs) =:= length(UniquePairs),
  206:                     
  207:                     %% 2. For each policy in main table, there's exactly one index entry
  208:                     OneToOne = length(MainPolicyIds) =:= length(IndexPolicyIds),
  209:                     
  210:                     %% 3. Bag index deletion uses delete_object (not delete)
  211:                     %% This ensures that only specific {tenant_id, policy_id} pairs are removed,
  212:                     %% not all entries for a tenant_id
  213:                     %% Verification: index should only contain pairs that exist in main table
  214:                     IndexPairsSet = sets:from_list(IndexPairs),
  215:                     MainPairsSet = sets:from_list([{TenantId, PolicyId} || {{_T, PolicyId}, _} <- AllMainPolicies]),
  216:                     IndexMatchesMain = sets:is_equal(IndexPairsSet, MainPairsSet),
  217:                     
  218:                     %% All checks must pass
  219:                     IndexConsistent andalso IndexComplete andalso NoDuplicates andalso OneToOne andalso IndexMatchesMain
  220:                 end
  221:             ),
  222:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}]) of
  223:                 true -> ok;
  224:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  225:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
  226:             end
  227:     end.
  228: 
  229: %% Generators
  230: 
  231: operation() ->
  232:     oneof([
  233:         upsert_operation(),
  234:         delete_operation()
  235:     ]).
  236: 
  237: upsert_operation() ->
  238:     ?LET(
  239:         {PolicyId, Weights},
  240:         {policy_id(), weights()},
  241:         {upsert, #policy{
  242:             tenant_id = <<"prop_tenant">>,
  243:             policy_id = PolicyId,
  244:             weights = Weights,
  245:             version = <<"1.0">>,
  246:             defaults = #{},
  247:             escalate_on = [],
  248:             fallback = undefined,
  249:             sticky = undefined,
  250:             metadata = #{}
  251:         }}
  252:     ).
  253: 
  254: delete_operation() ->
  255:     ?LET(
  256:         PolicyId,
  257:         policy_id(),
  258:         {delete, PolicyId}
  259:     ).
  260: 
  261: policy() ->
  262:     ?LET(
  263:         {PolicyId, Weights},
  264:         {policy_id(), weights()},
  265:         #policy{
  266:             tenant_id = <<"prop_tenant">>,
  267:             policy_id = PolicyId,
  268:             weights = Weights,
  269:             version = <<"1.0">>,
  270:             defaults = #{},
  271:             escalate_on = [],
  272:             fallback = undefined,
  273:             sticky = undefined,
  274:             metadata = #{}
  275:         }
  276:     ).
  277: 
  278: policy_id() ->
  279:     ?LET(
  280:         N,
  281:         integer(1, 1000),
  282:         list_to_binary("policy_" ++ integer_to_list(N))
  283:     ).
  284: 
  285: weights() ->
  286:     ?LET(
  287:         Providers,
  288:         list({provider_id(), weight()}),
  289:         maps:from_list(Providers)
  290:     ).
  291: 
  292: provider_id() ->
  293:     oneof([<<"openai">>, <<"anthropic">>, <<"cohere">>]).
  294: 
  295: weight() ->
  296:     ?LET(
  297:         W,
  298:         real(),
  299:         max(0.0, min(1.0, abs(W)))
  300:     ).
  301: 
  302: %% Helpers
  303: 
  304: execute_operation(TenantId, {upsert, Policy}) ->
  305:     router_policy_store:upsert_policy(TenantId, Policy);
  306: execute_operation(TenantId, {delete, PolicyId}) ->
  307:     router_policy_store:delete_policy(TenantId, PolicyId).
  308:
